report_title: Dog Walking Services in the US
executive_summary: With more than 189.0 million pets occupying the homes of over two-thirds of US households, according to the American Pet Products Association (APPA), Americans own more pets today than at any other time. Pet owners are also spending record amounts on their companions. According to APPA's 2023 State of the Industry Report, pet owners spent over $136.8 billion on pet-related goods and services including dog walking and pet sitting services. Growing pet ownership and greater spending on pet care provisions lead revenue to grow at a CAGR of 5.0% to $1.7 billion over the last few years, including an estimated loss of 0.4% in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Low Barriers of Entry Fueled Expansion
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Minimal start-up costs and training requirements make it easy for individuals to become dog walkers, contributing to revenue growth. A 2023 survey conducted by Pet Sitters International (PSI) revealed that approximately 99.0% of pet-sitting and dog-walking businesses are independently owned. Even though most dog-walking businesses are small, some owners have been able to expand into nationwide franchises.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Pet Owners are Increasingly Indulging Their Pets
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Some pet owners go above and beyond regarding pet care, spending more on animal apparel, massages, organic premium foods, pet-sitting services

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Pandemic Pet Boom Fueled the Market for Dog Walking Services
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: According to a survey by the ASPCA, 1 in 5 households acquired a pet during the pandemic. At first, consumers were at home and able to care for their dogs themselves. Once stay-at-home orders were lifted and employees returned to the office, the need for hired help intensified. The rise in pet ownership contributed to a boom in demand for dog-walking services in 2021 and 2022.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Dog Walking Services Will Continue to Be a Necessity
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: An improving domestic job market and increased working hours will drive demand for dog walking and pet sitting services, supporting industry revenue growth. Rising incomes will make it easier for pet owners to afford pet-related services, presenting an opportunity for expansion in the industry. Pet ownership – specifically, the number of dogs and cats – will steadily climb.

Increasing competitive pricing pressures because of greater concentration will keep profit growth constrained during the next five years. Potential recessionary concerns could limit spending on dog walking services as pet owners prioritize saving. Pets' place as a part of the family helps make these jobs somewhat recession-proof.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: ADAPTING TO NEW TECHNOLOGIES IS CRITICAL TO SUCCESS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Integrating new technologies allows businesses to stand out and meet changing customer expectations. Established dog-walking service companies must contend with growing internal competition from dog-walking businesses that offer new advanced technological services.

industry_definition: Businesses include establishments that provide dog walking services. Pet sitters, who commonly visit pet owners' homes to care for dogs and cats, are also included in this industry. The industry doesn't include companies that primarily offer pet grooming, training, boarding or other pet services, which are accounted for in the Pet Grooming and Boarding industry.
key_trends: Local markets are oversaturated and face intense competition.
Professional dog walkers respond by providing high-quality service and having insured and bonded dog walkers, which increases credibility and allows them to charge higher prices.
External competition comes from pet grooming and boarding services. These services often include dog walking, training and grooming to attract dog owners.
Low barriers of entry enable new entrants into dog walking services. Minimal required training and new technology make it easy for new businesses to establish themselves in a small market.
Companies leverage GPS technology to enhance services. Modern pet owners expect dog-walking companies to use these tools to ensure the safety and care of their pets.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Many consumers in this age group are parents of young children owning dogs or other pets. Established professionals in this age group lack time to take care of their pets while away from their homes but possess the disposable income to outsource these services to a dog walker.

As with the 35 to 54 demographic, consumers in this age group often have daytime professional obligations preventing them from caring for their dogs. Consumers in this cohort are most likely to travel for leisure and require dog sitters to provide care while the owners are away.
Younger consumers aged 25 to 34 own fewer pets than older consumers. This segment typically has less disposable income to spend on discretionary services.

Pet owners in these age groups don't have established professions and either lack the disposable income to pay for animal care services or have enough leisure time to care for their animals. Consumers in the older age group are often retired and often require dog sitters when they travel for vacation.
Pet owners in these age groups don't have established professions and either lack the disposable income to pay for animal care services or have enough leisure time to care for their animals.

products_and_services.product_description: Dog owners hire walkers to take their dogs on walks daily or several times a week for the animal to exercise and use the bathroom during day or night hours.

Dog walkers offer longer dog walks that can go as long as 60 or 90 minutes to get more exercise or outside stimulation for dogs during the day. Similar to shorter walks, these walks can be conducted in groups or individually and are subject to added premiums for additional exercise or other add-ons. Dog walkers typically charge $40.0 for an hour-long walk and up to $55.0 for a 90-minute exercise regimen.

Personal stand-ins are unavailable to all pet owners, and dog-walking professionals have embraced this market. Dog sitting services can be provided for the entire night and day or simply for several hours before and after the dog sleeps for the night. Pet owners prefer to avoid boarding their dogs in a kennel or dog hotel where conditions may be unfamiliar and likely full of anxious, barking dogs. Demand for animal sitting services suffered overall during COVID-19 in 2020 as stringent socioeconomic regulations forced individuals to cancel nearly all personal and business trips that year.

Other services include dog taxiing and wedding day services. Dog transportation and wedding day services are less common but more specialized because the person must be able to drive a vehicle and control the dog while surrounded by guests. This service typically has higher hourly rates than standard dog walking services.

tier_2_suppliers: Insurance Brokers & Agencies in the US
Direct Mail Advertising in the US
Internet Publishing and Broadcasting in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: As households adopt more cats and dogs, demand for pet services like dog walking and pet sitting increases. Over the past five years, the number of cats and dogs has exceeded US population growth; this has, in turn, increased demand for pet-service professionals capable of looking after multiple pets simultaneously.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region of the United States is home to over a quarter of the population, providing a large customer base for dog-walking businesses. Many of Florida's older and wealthier residents often require dog walking services, driving concentration in the region. Dog-walking businesses are in high demand in urban areas like Atlanta, Miami and Charlotte because of their dense populations and busy work schedules. A mild climate allows year-round use of dog walking services, ensuring consistent market stability.

Many young professionals and millennials in these areas prioritize pet care, boosting the need for dog walking services. The region's strong preference for outdoor activities also contributes to the growth of dog walking businesses, as residents seek to ensure their pets enjoy ample exercise. Dog walking services are particularly prevalent in Western states like California and Washington, especially in tech-centric cities like San Francisco and Seattle.

The Great Lakes and Mid-Atlantic regions also have large urban centers with high population densities. This creates a significant demand for dog walking services as busy residents seek convenient pet care solutions. States like New York, New Jersey and Illinois host affluent neighborhoods like Manhattan's Upper East Side, Chicago's Gold Coast and Northern Virginia suburbs. Residents there have disposable income for pet services, including dog walking.

The Great Lakes and Mid-Atlantic regions also have large urban centers with high population densities. This creates a significant demand for dog walking services as busy residents seek convenient pet care solutions. States like New York, New Jersey and Illinois host affluent neighborhoods like Manhattan's Upper East Side, Chicago's Gold Coast and Northern Virginia suburbs. Residents there have disposable income for pet services, including dog walking.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Some municipalities require dog walkers to obtain permits based on the number of dogs and locations they walk. For instance, San Francisco mandates permits and vehicle approvals for those walking more than four dogs at once, with a maximum limit of eight dogs.
Liability insurance is mandatory for dog walking services to cover potential lawsuits resulting from accidents or injuries to dogs or other individuals.
The Animal Welfare Act (AWA) is the primary federal legislation governing animal treatment in various sectors.

basis_points.basis_title: Local markets are oversaturated and face intense competition.
basis_points.basis_description: Professional dog walkers respond by providing high-quality service and having insured and bonded dog walkers, which increases credibility and allows them to charge higher prices.
External competition comes from pet grooming and boarding services. These services often include dog walking, training and grooming.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Dog walking services are highly fragmented
concentration_points.concentration_description: Individual dog walkers generate no significant share of total industry revenue.

concentration_points.concentration_title: The overwhelming majority of companies are small and cater to local markets
concentration_points.concentration_description: expanding beyond a neighborhood, city, or town poses logistical and organizational problems for companies that are difficult to overcome.

concentration_points.concentration_title: LOW ENTRY BARRIERS IMPLY FIERCE COMPETITION
concentration_points.concentration_description: New competitors can join the industry freely without substantial financial, operational, or regulatory barriers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: WAGES REPRESENT THE LARGEST BUSINESS EXPENSE
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wage rates vary depending on a dog walker's or sitter's location.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: THE BOOST OF SOCIAL MEDIA HAS KEPT MARKETING COSTS STABLE
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Marketing expenses include the costs of designing promotional items like business cards.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Dog walking is labor-intensive, requiring physical stamina and time management skills.

volatility_points.volatility_description: When people go on vacation, they often take their pets with them.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Consumer Spending and Disposable Income Influence Dog-Walking Services
volatility_points.volatility_description: Fluctuations in consumer spending can produce volatility as it shapes how pet owners spend on pet care.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Dog walking apps, like Wag! and Rover, often include features like tracking dog walks.

FAQs.question: What is the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) and how does it relate to the dog walking industry?
FAQs.answer: The Animal Welfare Act (AWA) is the primary federal legislation governing animal treatment in various sectors.

FAQs.question: How does the International Association of Canine Professionals (IACP) assist dog walkers?
FAQs.answer: The IACP offers substantial support to dog walkers by providing training certificates and educational materials.

FAQs.question: What kind of assistance does Pet Sitters International (PSI) provide to dog walking services?
FAQs.answer: PSI offers educational resources, certification programs, and marketing strategies tailored to the pet-care industry.

FAQs.question: Are sales in the dog walking industry reliant on the overall health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: While not entirely dependent on positive macroeconomic conditions, a healthy economy certainly spurs demand.

FAQs.question: Does the dog walking industry partner with local businesses for advertising?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators can boost their market access by partnering with local businesses.

FAQs.question: How does the dog walking industry respond to fluctuations in demand?
FAQs.answer: The industry responds to robust demand by hiring more workers.

FAQs.question: How do dog walking companies manage operating expenses for profitability?
FAQs.answer: Industry dog walking businesses must find a way to manage costs without sacrificing quality standards.

FAQs.question: Does the dog walking industry leverage social media for market presence?
FAQs.answer: The use of dog walking mobile platforms such as Wag! and Rover has largely expanded within the industry.

FAQs.question: What technologies do dog walking companies utilize?
FAQs.answer: While the majority of industry companies are sole proprietors, these individuals can use record-keeping software.

FAQs.question: What compliance measures are important for the dog walking industry?
FAQs.answer: Industry companies must heavily vet dog walkers and sitters to ensure safety.

FAQs.question: How does the number of households influence demand for dog walking services?
FAQs.answer: A rise in the number of households will likely increase the number of pet owners in the United States.

FAQs.question: How does per capita disposable income affect the dog walking industry?
FAQs.answer: Increased disposable income tends to boost expenditure on pet-related services.

FAQs.question: How does the number of pets influence demand for dog walking?
FAQs.answer: As households adopt more pets, demand for pet services increases.
